title: Free alternative walking tour featuring Berlin's Street Art
description: Pay as you wish while exploring the vibrant street art culture in Berlin, known for its colorful murals, graffiti, and urban art installations.

title: Spend a day at Mauerpark
description: Berlin's most famous, biggest and busiest vintage scene is at Mauerpark. This Sunday flea market sees storeholders selling everything from clothes by local designers to eclectic collections of vintage items. It also hosts the immensely popular weekly outdoor singing kareoke session.

title: Appreciate queer culture in a drag queen show
description: Have a crazy entertaining night by seeing queen Judy Ladivina lipsync on every possible language while you struggle to hold your licor on wednesday night

title: See Berlin's most famous landmarks by boat
description: In good weather it's an amazing way to see Berlin's main sights and scenic neighborhoods. In colder weather, the boats have indoor seating as well. Put me on a boat and put a Bier in my hand, and it's all good.

title: Visit Museum Island
description: Home to a cluster of world-renowned museums and significant historical treasures, Museum Island is an unmissable destination for art and history enthusiasts.

title: Get lost at KitKat (but not on tourists day!)
description: Choose a nice party, take offf most of your clothes and enjoy the many possibilities in this sex positive famous spot.

title: Flirt old style at Silverfuture queer wednesday night
description: There was a time before phones where people actually went to bars to meet others. At Silverfure once a month you get 'Love is in the Air' evening, when notes are passed from table to table in an encouraging manner

title: Walk along the Berlin Wall
description: Take a trip back in time and visit the remaining sections of the Berlin Wall, a powerful symbol of the Cold War era and the division of East and West Berlin.

title: Grab a bier with a view in Tiergarten Park
description: Take a leisurely stroll through Berlin's largest and most popular park, featuring green spaces, walking paths, and iconic monuments.

title: Get fully naked and relaxed at Vabali
description: In pretty much every spa in Berlin, clothes are forbidden and are mixed-gender. While this might sound intimidating, it is perfectly normal in Germany, meaning almost all the time, people aren't creepy at all. It's fun, relaxing and actually liberating!

title: Enjoy the freedom of open air kino
description: Sit on beach chairs, grab a beer and enjoy both blockbusters or classic movies in open air kino. Highlight for old musicals, Dirty Dancing is on every year.

title: Eat as much as you can in Thaipark
description: Recently moved to a new location, you can enjoy PadThai and Mango Sticky Rice on a sunny day for very affordable price

title: Confront a dark past at the Jewish Museum
description: Going to the Jewish Museum can make for a challenging, but a visit here should be high on your things to visit in Berlin. Since 2001, the museum has showcased the vast experiences of the Jewish people, both their past and present.

title: Grab late night beers at a Späti with the locals
description: Maybe you even see Heid Klum queing for her Kebab and späti beer. In cold or warm weather, berliners are always having a late night beer on every corner.

title: Go on an early evening date at Sudblock
description: The Kottywood party is a popular go-to for gays and lesbians looking to catch someone's eyes while listening to Latin, retro and pop music. Südblock also serves food, ranging from breakfast to midnight snacks.
